intro: Berkheya echinopsoides, commonly known as the African burweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of disk florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Berkheya echinopsoides is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
